availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Daughter of James A. Cartwright and Adeline Graves Cartwright. Married to John B. Wall in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on May 25, 1842. Mother of James B. Wall, Adeline C. Wall, Charles J. Wall, John T. Wall, and James Wall. Resident of Caldwell County in 1850. Household owned ten enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Resident of Calloway County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 377B-378A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, p. 352.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 249.
"Arabella Dodds "Belle" Cartwright Wall (1819-1888)," Find A Grave, Memorial #10371552, accessed May 7, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/10371552.
KYR-0001-020-0001.
